title: Intermittent fasting is as effective as counting calories, new study finds
description: Limiting when you eat to a 6- or 8-hour window can help reduce calorie intake. While the weight loss isn't dramatic, it may be easier to stick to than counting calories.

title: Putin insists Russia is united after the Wagner Group uprising, vows to uphold deal
description: In a brief five-minute speech, Putin seemed to reaffirm a deal he reached to end the conflict, which resulted in Wagner Group commander Yevgeny Prigozhin being exiled to Belarus.

title: A Belgian shot-putter runs the hurdles after answering her team's call for help
description: "I really love it," Jolien Boumkwo said as her unusual turn in the 100-meter hurdles created a sensation.

title: Anti-war Russians watched the Wagner mutiny from Turkey, and worry about what's next
description: Russians who fled to Turkey after their country invaded Ukraine worry that Russian President Vladimir Putin may increase repressive measures that will affect their loved ones back home.

title: Harvard professor who studies dishonesty is accused of falsifying data
description: Francesca Gino, a prominent behavioral science professor at Harvard Business School, has been accused of fabricating data in studies than span over a decade, and most recently in 2020.

title: The week in Ukraine: When Prigozhin turned Wagner's tanks on Russia (June 26)
description: Catch up on key developments and the latest in-depth coverage of Russia's invasion of Ukraine.

title: In historic bid, transgender Delaware state senator launches congressional campaign
description: If elected, Sarah McBride, 32, would be the first transgender person to serve in Congress. She is running for the at-large seat held by Democratic Rep. Lisa Blunt Rochester.

title: A Texas airport worker died after being sucked into the engine of a Delta plane
description: For the second time in nearly seven months, an airport worker was killed after being pulled into an operating jet engine. The latest incident occurred Friday night in San Antonio, Texas.

title: Up First briefing: Russian rebellion; 'Cop City' protests; Alzheimer's drug approval
description: Yevgeny Prigozhin launched a failed rebellion in Russia. Activists in Atlanta hold a week of action against a police training facility. An Alzheimer's drug could be approved soon, but hurdles remain.

title: 3 works in translation: History and literature intertwined
description: It is easy to act as if fiction and history were separate. But they cannot be completely divided. Jenny Erpenbeck's Kairos and Oksana Lutsyshyna's Ivan and Phoebe help readers connect with time past.

title: Australia brings its last refugee on the Pacific island of Nauru to its mainland
description: Australia's government, which announced earlier this month that it would be moving refugees off of Nauru, confirmed to media that it will pay $350 million annually to keep the Nauru facility open.

title: An Alzheimer's drug is on the way, but getting it may still be tough. Here's why
description: The Food and Drug Administration is expected to grant full approval to the Alzheimer's drug lecanemab by July 6. But access to the drug may still be limited.

title: An Indigenous lacrosse team reclaims its native identity
description: A top lacrosse team — Haudenosaunee Nationals — is reclaiming its Indigenous identity after generations of being known as the Iroquois Nationals. Current team members say that name was derogatory.

title: China owns 300,000 acres of land in the U.S. Here's where
description: Chinese companies and individuals own farmland across America. But lawmakers in Washington are pushing to block any purchases that could be connected to the Chinese Communist Party.

title: Mitch Landrieu is Biden's man to rebuild America and deliver broadband to millions
description: This is the year that a lot of the money from Biden's 2021 infrastructure law starts flowing to states and local governments. Mitch Landrieu is tasked with implementing and promoting the effort.

title: 'We're not doing that': A Black couple won't crowdfund to pay medical debt
description: Kristie Fields, a cancer patient in Virginia was urged to go public to seek help for her medical bills. But she worried about feeding hurtful stereotypes.

title: Meet Scooter, the winner of this year's World's Ugliest Dog contest
description: A Chinese Crested pooch born with backward hind legs — a rescue once destined for death — has been crowned the "World's Ugliest Dog."

title: Why do some people get rashes in space? There's a clue in astronaut blood
description: A new study of astronaut blood finds that space travel reduces the expression of 100 genes related to the immune system.

title: Without paid family leave, teachers stockpile sick days and aim for summer babies
description: Less  than one-fifth the largest school districts offer paid parental leave for teachers, and only a handful of states guarantee it. That leaves few options for educators who want to start a family.

title: U.S. pedestrian deaths reach a 40-year high
description: The number of pedestrians killed by drivers has been climbing for over a decade. Experts say some solutions are within reach.

title: Sarah, the Duchess of York, undergoes surgery following breast cancer diagnosis
description: The 63-year-old was diagnosed with early-stage breast cancer following a routine mammogram. The surgery was a success and Sarah's prognosis is good, the duchess's spokesperson said.

title: After its march toward Moscow, what's next for Russia's Wagner Group?
description: The fate of the private military company is unclear, especially after it was credited with delivering Russia recent gains in the country's war against Ukraine.
